Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Wednesday August 13), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, august 13th. 

first up, amazon has announced plans to invest $4 billion in artificial intelligence company anthropic. the move is seen as part of amazon's strategy to deepen its ai capabilities and integrate more machine learning solutions across its ecosystem. anthropic, recognized for its research in creating safe ai, will reportedly help amazon in enhancing ai safety and reliability, further bolstering its competitive stance in the ai race.

meanwhile, google's parent company alphabet has reported a surge in its cloud revenue, which exceeded wall street expectations. google cloud's performance has been pivotal amid intensifying competition with aws and microsoft's azure. alphabet attributes this growth primarily to new enterprise customers and innovations in data management capabilities.

in social media news, x (formerly known as twitter) has rolled out a new subscription feature aimed at content creators. this feature will allow creators to set up premium content offerings and monetize their presence on the platform better. x's latest move aligns with its efforts to explore alternative revenue streams and strengthen community engagement.

finally, semiconductor powerhouse intel has announced its ambitious roadmap to regain market leadership by 2025. under ceo pat gelsinger, intel has outlined plans to innovate its chip architecture and manufacturing processes. investors are closely watching these developments as intel aims to outperform rivals in the high-performance computing space.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, august 13th.

starting with amazon, the tech giant has unveiled plans to pour $4 billion into the ai company anthropic. this initiative underscores amazon’s strategy to bolster its ai capabilities and weave more machine learning solutions into its offerings. anthropic is renowned for its commitment to creating safe ai, and their expertise will aid amazon in boosting the reliability and safety of its ai operations, giving it a competitive edge in the ai landscape.

turning to google’s parent company, alphabet has reported a robust upswing in cloud revenue, surpassing wall street's expectations. the stellar performance of google cloud is crucial as it battles for supremacy with amazon web services and microsoft azure. alphabet credits this growth to a surge in new enterprise clients and cutting-edge innovations in data management.

in social media news, x, formerly known as twitter, has launched a new subscription feature directed at content creators. this will enable creators to provide premium content and monetize their presence more effectively on the platform. x's latest initiative fits into its broader efforts to explore new revenue streams and enhance community engagement.

finally, in semiconductors, intel has charted a bold roadmap to reclaim market leadership by 2025. ceo pat gelsinger is steering intel toward groundbreaking innovations in chip architecture and manufacturing. investors are keenly eyeing these developments as intel vies to outpace competitors in the high-performance computing sector.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-343 Amazon's $4b Ai Investment 🤖, Alphabet's Cloud Triumph ☁️, X's Subscription Shift 💡
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, august 13th! dive into today's top tech stories:

  • amazon invests in anthropic: amazon commits $4 billion to the ai company, enhancing its machine learning offerings and focusing on safe ai practices to bolster reliability and competitive edge.
  • alphabet's cloud revenue surge: google’s parent company reports strong cloud revenue growth, surpassing expectations, driven by new enterprise clients and innovations in data management.
  • x launches creator subscriptions: x, formerly twitter, introduces a subscription feature for content creators, enhancing monetization opportunities and exploring new revenue streams.
  • intel's 2025 leadership roadmap: intel unveils plans for innovation in chip architecture and manufacturing, aiming to reclaim market leadership in high-performance computing.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set against a dynamic, futuristic cityscape at dusk. in the foreground, a sleek robotic figure symbolizes amazon's $4 billion ai investment, interacting with digital interfaces that shimmer with vibrant data streams. above, fluffy digital clouds, representing alphabet's cloud achievements, softly envelop city skyscrapers, hinting at endless storage and connectivity. to the side, an array of subscription icons float gently, symbolizing x's subscription shift, surrounded by subtle light pulses that suggest innovation and change. the elements seamlessly blend, creating a harmonious and forward-looking composition that highlights the convergence of artificial intelligence, cloud technology, and subscription services
